title: Report describes Apple’s “organizational dysfunction” and “lack of ambition” in AI
description: Sources say Apple's conservative approach makes it less competitive.

title: Woman faked elaborate illness, doctors say in report on “factitious disorder”
description: The woman said she had a rare, serious condition, but the details didn't add up.

title: Tile should—and needs to—do better than the DIY-looking “Tile for Cats”
description: One Tile tracker sold in a plastic collar attachment is not an innovation.

title: Top Twitter influencers flee to Bluesky amid Musk’s continued debasing
description: Bluesky's CEO clarified: "Twitter does not own us."

title: It’s the end of the line for yearly Windows 10 updates, says Microsoft
description: Windows 10 will still get security updates until mid-October 2025.

title: FBI agents search home of FTX exec who gave millions to Republicans
description: Ryan Salame formed "megadonor" team with SBF, gave $24M to mostly GOP candidates.

title: I, for one, welcome our new Steam Deck-killing, Windows-running overlords

title: YouTube podcasts go live in the US with inclusion in YouTube Music
description: YouTube podcasts landed on the web last year, and now there's app support.

title: Microsoft-branded mice and keyboards are going away after 40 years
description: Higher-end Surface-branded accessories will carry on, at least for now.

title: Despite UK ruling, Microsoft/Activision merger might not be dead just yet
description: Appeals could take months, but a carveout could preserve the deal outside the UK.

title: Nuke-launching AI would be illegal under proposed US law
description: Markey and Lieu seek to ban fed funds for nuke launches without "meaningful human control."

title: Daimler is setting up a $650 million charging network for commercial EVs

title: Old smartphones should be usable as single-board computers, just as this one is
description: Why can't more old Android phones become cool, Spotify-for-you music servers?

title: Intel loses $2.8 billion in another not-great quarter, down 36% year over year
description: And Intel's leadership says it will still take time to turn things around.

description: The National Academies call for the US to be smart about new reactor designs.

description: Various options are still available to nudge the important instrument.

description: The Vitamix 5200 rarely sees discounts outside of Black Friday.

title: OLED is great, but where are all the Mini LED laptops?
description: We dig into the research and interview companies about the potential of Mini LED.
